entry.title: App is OP
entry.content:
Color grading and edits are amazing, especially the AI assisted features.
They just added the capability to deband artifacting and edit videos. I just made a 16K video using Super Resolution, so big that the encoding won't even work.

App is OP

Color grading and edits are amazing, especially the AI assisted features.

They just added the capability to deband artifacting and edit videos. I just made a 16K video using Super Resolution, so big that the encoding won't even work.

entry.title: This program rocks.
entry.content:
Pixelmator Pro is the bomb. It just keeps getting better. I learned on CS2 waaay back in the day, and had a subscription to PS for awhile, but its just not worth it unless you're in that enviroment making money everyday.
As an artist manipulating pics and promos of my work, Pixelmator does everything I need it to do. I don't miss the features it doesn't have because I don't need those features. I have no idea what they are, and don't care.
Thanks to the devs who created and maintain this. Keep it up for us little A artists.

This program rocks.

As an artist manipulating pics and promos of my work, Pixelmator does everything I need it to do. I don't miss the features it doesn't have because I don't need those features. I have no idea what they are, and don't care.

Thanks to the devs who created and maintain this. Keep it up for us little A artists.

entry.title: Best Mac App ever
entry.content:
My first ever app purchase and I can confidently say after Two Years of using this software, it was the best $20 dollars I have ever spent.
The app gets constant updates with, Useful, new features. The UI is easy and very intutive to use.
I love their tutorials, and I've managed to create beautiful works of art by combining raster and vector images seemlessly, something which I found very hard to do with Adobe.
This app is perfect for the hobbyist. I've tried out Adobe, Acron, Affinity, all of the other competetiors and I still think this app is the best in terms of UI design, workflow and capabilities.

Best Mac App ever

My first ever app purchase and I can confidently say after Two Years of using this software, it was the best $20 dollars I have ever spent.

The app gets constant updates with, Useful, new features. The UI is easy and very intutive to use.

I love their tutorials, and I've managed to create beautiful works of art by combining raster and vector images seemlessly, something which I found very hard to do with Adobe.

This app is perfect for the hobbyist. I've tried out Adobe, Acron, Affinity, all of the other competetiors and I still think this app is the best in terms of UI design, workflow and capabilities.

entry.title: Intruitive & Designed For Design
entry.content:
If you're familiar with Apple-Family software like Keynote or Pages, you'll jump right in on this piece of software. It's designed around efficient design and is very effective at that. There are tools that encourage play but not so many that they distract from the core functionality of the software.
Absolutely worth the twenty dollarydoos or whatever it cost.

If you're familiar with Apple-Family software like Keynote or Pages, you'll jump right in on this piece of software. It's designed around efficient design and is very effective at that. There are tools that encourage play but not so many that they distract from the core functionality of the software.

entry.title: 绝对良心软件
entry.content: 这款软件绝对是良心软件，每次更新虽然都是小功能，但是这些小功能是非常实用的，并且完全充分的利用mac平台本身的硬件加速功能，使用非常流畅。Affinity系列软件在没有重大更新的基础上就强行圈钱升级一波，pixelmator pro绝对是算够体贴用户的。下次大版本更新一定也花钱购买

entry.title: An excellent app that continues to improve
entry.content: Pixelmator Pro is probably my favorite app on my Mac Mini. It is intuitive, powerful, and fairly priced. The feel of the app is very similiar to one designed by Apple. For personal use I use Pixelmator to clean up photos, and for work I use it to clean up documents for my classroom. If there is some function I don't understand it is incredibly easy to learn without much effort. The amount of value I have got out of this app can not be over-emphasized.

An excellent app that continues to improve

If there is some function I don't understand it is incredibly easy to learn without much effort. The amount of value I have got out of this app can not be over-emphasized.

entry.title: Great update from Pixelmator Classic
entry.content: I have been wanting to check out the new Pixelmator features in Pro for some time now. I was lacking a computer thta could handle the update though. While I may have liked to go with the 14" Macbook Pro the new Macbook Air with the M2 chip seemed a great upgrade to my old 2013 Macbook Pro and so far I am happy. I immediately got Pixelmator Pro and I've been playing around for days. I have a backlog of projects that I am pleased to say will take less time than I anticpated with all of the new features. The look and feel is very much Pixelmator; but I have new options to select by color or remove background (little buggy depending on the image). I haven't even gotten to the video update or the illustrator features but I will in upcoming projects. Overall very pleased I could upgrade my system and my app!! Way to go Pixelmator knocking it out of the park all over again!

Great update from Pixelmator Classic

I have been wanting to check out the new Pixelmator features in Pro for some time now. I was lacking a computer thta could handle the update though. While I may have liked to go with the 14" Macbook Pro the new Macbook Air with the M2 chip seemed a great upgrade to my old 2013 Macbook Pro and so far I am happy. I immediately got Pixelmator Pro and I've been playing around for days. I have a backlog of projects that I am pleased to say will take less time than I anticpated with all of the new features. The look and feel is very much Pixelmator; but I have new options to select by color or remove background (little buggy depending on the image). I haven't even gotten to the video update or the illustrator features but I will in upcoming projects. Overall very pleased I could upgrade my system and my app!! Way to go Pixelmator knocking it out of the park all over again!

entry.title: Disappointing
entry.content: From the glowing reviews, I expected to love this upgrade, but I don't. It is so different from Classic that it has a very steep learning curve. I like the UI being all in one place as opposed to Classic's palates, but that's the only thing Iike about Pro. In terms of ease of use and getting the results I want, Classic does the job much better and much easier. I've gone back to Classic and regret purchasing Pro. For me, Pro was a complete waste of money.

Disappointing

From the glowing reviews, I expected to love this upgrade, but I don't. It is so different from Classic that it has a very steep learning curve. I like the UI being all in one place as opposed to Classic's palates, but that's the only thing Iike about Pro. In terms of ease of use and getting the results I want, Classic does the job much better and much easier. I've gone back to Classic and regret purchasing Pro. For me, Pro was a complete waste of money.

entry.title: Great for non-pro users
entry.content: Truth be told, all photo editing programs are very complicated if you have never used one before and most are designed for people who spend many, many hours developing proficiency in their use. Pixelmator Pro is a reasonable alternitve to Photshop-level editors, one I was able to figure out without reading any directions after having not used a photo editor in years. But it is still very capable. A good choice and a good value for anyone needing to do some photo fix-up, every now and then.

Great for non-pro users

Truth be told, all photo editing programs are very complicated if you have never used one before and most are designed for people who spend many, many hours developing proficiency in their use. Pixelmator Pro is a reasonable alternitve to Photshop-level editors, one I was able to figure out without reading any directions after having not used a photo editor in years. But it is still very capable. A good choice and a good value for anyone needing to do some photo fix-up, every now and then.

entry.title: Crashed on my M1 and auto-saved over my original photo
entry.content:
I was playing with the app, used the "ML Enhance" button and the app crashed. Now my original photo cant be recovered and is ruined by an obnoxious object over the subject of the photo.
Really needs version tracking... otherwise great app with lots of features for a good price.

Crashed on my M1 and auto-saved over my original photo

I was playing with the app, used the "ML Enhance" button and the app crashed. Now my original photo cant be recovered and is ruined by an obnoxious object over the subject of the photo.

Really needs version tracking... otherwise great app with lots of features for a good price.

entry.title: Video Editing is Cool
entry.content: The new video editing feature is amazing. Import a video. Add effects and composite on new layers, then export as MP4. They keep on adding features to the software. Best purchase ever.

Video Editing is Cool

The new video editing feature is amazing. Import a video. Add effects and composite on new layers, then export as MP4. They keep on adding features to the software. Best purchase ever.

entry.title: The only viable alternative to the flagship photo-editing program
entry.content: I've tried most of the alternative photo-editing programs, including one that starts with A and ends in Y, and this is the only viable replacement to PS. If you're serious about having a proper alternative, this is the final frontier, and it also comes equipped with an expansive set of illustration tools. It seems as if everyday I discover something new in Pixelmator Pro that solidifies my notion about being the only viable alternative. The price is the standout attention grabber because it is a STEAL. This program is 100% a must-have in every artist's / graphic designer's arsenal.

The only viable alternative to the flagship photo-editing program

If you're serious about having a proper alternative, this is the final frontier, and it also comes equipped with an expansive set of illustration tools. It seems as if everyday I discover something new in Pixelmator Pro that solidifies my notion about being the only viable alternative. The price is the standout attention grabber because it is a STEAL. This program is 100% a must-have in every artist's / graphic designer's arsenal.

entry.title: Great tool, room for improvement in photo editing
entry.content: This is a great editor with a lot of features. It takes a while to get all of them understood. What I found missing was more portrait AI editing, like auto blemish fix faces, softening, etc. Hopefully I'm either missing the features or they arrive soon.

Great tool, room for improvement in photo editing

This is a great editor with a lot of features. It takes a while to get all of them understood. What I found missing was more portrait AI editing, like auto blemish fix faces, softening, etc. Hopefully I'm either missing the features or they arrive soon.

entry.title: Missing an important feature
entry.content:
While this is a great app, occasionally a user needs support. I needed to know if it supported importing and editing multi-page PDFs so I submitted a ticket on their website. I finally received a reply after seven days. Sadly, Pixelmator Pro does not support importing multi-page PDFs...each page has to be imported as a separate layer. If this is important to you, until this feature is added, you'll need to manually import each PDF page as a separate layer.
UPDATE: (Adding another star.) The developer reached out with a very plausible reason for the slow support and a promised to let folks know in the future (in the support ticket reply) if a slowdown could be expected. That's all anyone could ask for.

Missing an important feature

While this is a great app, occasionally a user needs support. I needed to know if it supported importing and editing multi-page PDFs so I submitted a ticket on their website. I finally received a reply after seven days. Sadly, Pixelmator Pro does not support importing multi-page PDFs...each page has to be imported as a separate layer. If this is important to you, until this feature is added, you'll need to manually import each PDF page as a separate layer.

UPDATE: (Adding another star.) The developer reached out with a very plausible reason for the slow support and a promised to let folks know in the future (in the support ticket reply) if a slowdown could be expected. That's all anyone could ask for.

entry.title: all good BUT
entry.content: When will the ML noise reduction function be fixed?

all good BUT

When will the ML noise reduction function be fixed?

entry.title: Surprisingly fun!
entry.content:
I'm very new to Pixelmator so I'm sure I am missing some of the best points. Long time Photoshop and Affinit photo user but I teach and a fair amount of my students use Pixelmator - so I try to learn tools to be able to help the students where they're at.
The only downside for me is trying to learn another UI. Most other adobe contenders mimic the same workspace(s) Pixelmator goes its own road. Once you get used to that, Pixelmator is straight forward and has a ton of on-line support/tutorials.
Every time I go to watch a tutorial to learn how to do something I end up thinking "of course it's that simple" and "why didn't I try that first?" That sense of wonder, awe, simple accomplishment, makes the app fun to learn.
The integration into the apple ecosystem and apps is a huge plus for me as well!

Surprisingly fun!

I'm very new to Pixelmator so I'm sure I am missing some of the best points.
Long time Photoshop and Affinit photo user but I teach and a fair amount of my students use Pixelmator - so I try to learn tools to be able to help the students where they're at.

The only downside for me is trying to learn another UI. Most other adobe contenders mimic the same workspace(s) Pixelmator goes its own road. Once you get used to that, Pixelmator is straight forward and has a ton of on-line support/tutorials.

Every time I go to watch a tutorial to learn how to do something I end up thinking "of course it's that simple" and "why didn't I try that first?"
That sense of wonder, awe, simple accomplishment, makes the app fun to learn.

The integration into the apple ecosystem and apps is a huge plus for me as well!

entry.title: This is What Photoshop Should Be!
entry.content: Like many others, I ignored this app for the longest time because I was already a Photoshop user for many years. I finally bought the app for my personal computer and am blown away by the simplicity of it! The layout is like Photoshop but reorganized by someone who actually knows how the human brain works. Everything is so straightforward and clear but yet just as powerful as Photoshop (at least for my purposes). I'm kicking myself that I didn't try this sooner!

This is What Photoshop Should Be!

Like many others, I ignored this app for the longest time because I was already a Photoshop user for many years. I finally bought the app for my personal computer and am blown away by the simplicity of it! The layout is like Photoshop but reorganized by someone who actually knows how the human brain works. Everything is so straightforward and clear but yet just as powerful as Photoshop (at least for my purposes). I'm kicking myself that I didn't try this sooner!

entry.title: The Adobe Replacement
entry.content: I'd grown tired of Adobe's near-extortionary subscription practices; however, like many I felt locked into their applications. Over the year that I've used Pixelmator I have truly grown to love it. There's an ever so slight learning curve coming over from Photoshop but nothing that Pixelmator's awesome help articles (or a quick Google search) can't resolve. I'm happily away from Lightroom and Photoshop and I couldn't be more thankful that I gave Pixelmator a shot! Don't pass this app up!

The Adobe Replacement

I'd grown tired of Adobe's near-extortionary subscription practices; however, like many I felt locked into their applications. Over the year that I've used Pixelmator I have truly grown to love it. There's an ever so slight learning curve coming over from Photoshop but nothing that Pixelmator's awesome help articles (or a quick Google search) can't resolve. I'm happily away from Lightroom and Photoshop and I couldn't be more thankful that I gave Pixelmator a shot! Don't pass this app up!

entry.title: A Program of Discovery
entry.content: Pixelmator Pro 3.0 will encourage you to discover imaging techniques (especially in photography) that you never even thought of, since it offers easy-to-use tools outside of your naive experience. I never realized this with the old Pixelmator but the new Pro is fantastic for the small cost it entails.

A Program of Discovery

Pixelmator Pro 3.0 will encourage you to discover imaging techniques (especially in photography) that you never even thought of, since it offers easy-to-use tools outside of your naive experience. I never realized this with the old Pixelmator but the new Pro is fantastic for the small cost it entails.

entry.title: What Adobe Photoshop COULD have been
entry.content: Philosophically and support-wise Adobe abanodoned Apple some time ago in favor of the Adobe's Windows applications. So Pixelmator Pro is what Adobe Photoshop and other Adobe design applications COULD have become had the company not lost its way. I'm so so glad Pixelmator came along so that my list of Adobe applications on my Mac has shrunk from 7 to zero. I don't miss a single one of them and I'm spared Adobe's processor & money sucking Creative Cloud design suite.

entry.title: Great UX, becoming my "go to" for random design and image needs
entry.content:
I should have launched Pixelmator Pro first.
I wasted an hour digging through Affinity Photo, Affinity Design, and Vectornator for just some basic perspective-transform tools to make a screenshot look like it was in 3d space by adjusting its perspective.
All of those apps might do what I needed, but they hid it from me too well. Pixelmator's sane UX let me discover what I needed in seconds.

Great UX, becoming my "go to" for random design and image needs

I should have launched Pixelmator Pro first.

I wasted an hour digging through Affinity Photo, Affinity Design, and Vectornator for just some basic perspective-transform tools to make a screenshot look like it was in 3d space by adjusting its perspective.

All of those apps might do what I needed, but they hid it from me too well. Pixelmator's sane UX let me discover what I needed in seconds.
